agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Greencastle

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Greencastle

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Provides free smoke alarms to household in need, when funds are available.
site_details: Call to check availability.
site_eligibility: Homeowners -- Financial need

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - PUTNAM COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - PUTNAM COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law, collections, or consumer law cases and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, and White County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Clay, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk to door and ring bell.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the county and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in Putnam County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the birth or death certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Putnam County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the county. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the county or for details about licensing and food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Putnam County

service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A nonprofit health clinic that provides family planning services.
service_description: Offers family planning services on a sliding-scale basis for eligible persons. Services include pelvic exam, Pap test, and breast exam, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and pregnancy tests, including pregnancy verification required for public benefits. Pregnancy tests and condoms are available free on a walk-in basis.

site_schedule: Wed and Fri 8am-6pm; Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-5pm
site_eligibility: For pelvic exams/Pap tests: Women of childbearing age -- For STD testing/treatment: Women and men -- Under age 55

agency_desc: A career and technical education center providing adult education and high school equivalency classes.
service_description: Offers instruction in basic language arts, math, reading, science, and social studies as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Morning and evening classes are available throughout the year.
site_details: Call for class times and to schedule an appointment for the next monthly enrollment session.
site_eligibility: Ages 16 and older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: A career and technical education center providing adult education and high school equivalency classes.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place six times a year and is available on paper and pencil only.
site_details: Walk in at least one week prior to exam to register; call or visit the website for test schedule. Test takers under age 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian to register for the test.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older; ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system (form available at Area 30 Career Center) -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF PUTNAM COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health association dedicated to promoting community wide mental health and improving the quality of life of residents impacted by mental illness through advocacy, education, collaboration, support services and prevention activities.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Provides a court-ordered class for parents who are divorcing, legally separating, or involved in paternity cases where the children will be living in separate households. Parents gain insight and skills that will assist their children to effectively cope with the change. This class is mandated for all separating parents with children under the age of 18. A corresponding course is available for children ages 7-12 and one-time counseling session is available for adolescents.
site_details: Call for schedule information or to register. Course registration must be completed one week prior to class.
site_eligibility: Divorced/Divorcing Persons -- Court-ordered by Putnam County judges

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF PUTNAM COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Builds new homes and rehabilitates, remodels, and repairs existing homes for eligible low-income persons in Putnam County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application. -- Voicemails can be left outside of office hours.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-60% of area median income -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: Provides emergency shelter services for women and women with children, in Putnam County and the immediate surrounding area.
service_description: Provides an emergency homeless shelter for single women and women with children. Includes meals, shower, laundry facilities, and case management. Initial stay is thirty days with extensions that may be granted based on evaluation of personal transition goals.
site_details: Call for availability and begin inquiry and intake process. If a bed is available, and background check comes back clean and meets additional intake criteria, an appointment to meet will be scheduled.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam, Parke, Montgomery, Hendricks, Clay and Owen County -- women -OR- women with children (ages 17 and under) -- No sexual offenders, persons with a violent felony within the past 5 years, or persons with an outstanding warrant.
